intro: Angadenia prieurei, commonly known as the Prieure's angadenia, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vivid orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in areas with high sunlight exposure. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
